required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Manipulation on Dysfunction of the Talo-crural Joint
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Manipulation on Dysfunction of the Talo-crural Joint- a Clinical Randomised Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial was to explore the effects of chiropractic manipulation in patients with talo-crural joint dysfunction.

detailed_description.textblock:
Ankle sprains is one of the most common problems in clinical practice, mostly due to loss of mobility. Factors affecting the mobility of the joints may be due to muscle tension, ligamentous or anatomical anomalies.
Research over the last years have reported a scarce of trials investigating chiropractic treatment of the ankle joint. Previous studies have focused on investigating ROM and proprioception. This study aimed to determine whether a single high-velocity, low-amplitude (HVLA) thrust manipulation to the talo-crural joint altered ankle function in subjects with dysfunction of the talo-crural joint.

primary_outcome.measure: Counter movement jump; IVAR test system
primary_outcome.description: First assessment: One leg single jump before and after treatment (active or placebo)

secondary_outcome.measure: Counter movement jump; IVAR test system
secondary_outcome.description: Second assessment: Active or placebo treatment if needed

secondary_outcome.measure: Counter movement jump; IVAR test system
secondary_outcome.description: Third assessment: One leg single jump before and after treatment (active or placebo

arm_group.description: Single high-velocity, low-amplitude (HVLA) thrust manipulation towards Tibia, not affecting the dysfunctional talo-crural joint
Single high-velocity, low-amplitude (HVLA long axis) thrust manipulation on dysfunctional talo-crural joint

intervention.description: Single high-velocity, low-amplitude (HVLA long axis) thrust manipulation to the talo-crural joint, once a week during a three week period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First league handball player
- Talo-crural joint dysfunction
- Age >16 yrs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a history of recent trauma or previous operations with remaining fixation material in the foot or ankle
